Pagination

Pagination element is used to help browsing a large set of similar items divided into multiple pages (e.g. search results). The element provides navigation between pages and a selection of how many items are shown on one page.

If the number of pages goes over what can be presented

  • Keep Previous and Next are always visible
  • Keep First and second first pages always visible
  • Keep Last and second last pages always visible
  • indicate with "..." that the list is longer than what can be displayed
  • When user clicks further display "..." on left and right as needed
  • Always centre the page that has been selected so that it becomes the second link in the "middle group"

Default pagination

  • previous
  • 1
  • 2
  • 3
  • 4
  • ...
  • 15
  • next
{% highlight html %}
  • previous
  • 1
  • 2
  • 3
  • 4
  • 5
  • ...
  • next
{% endhighlight %}

Disabled and active states

Links are customizable for different circumstances. Use .disabled for unclickable links and .active to indicate the current page.

  • previous
  • 1 (current)
  • 2
  • 3
  • 4
  • ...
  • 15
  • next
{% highlight html %}
  • previous
  • 1 (current)
    • ...
  • ...
    • ...
{% endhighlight %}
